title: Convert CAPEX into OPEX
description: Reduce up-front build costs for large solar arrays overdesigned for peak power and purchase power as a service when and where it is needed.
impact: Lower initial mission CAPEX with flexible operating expenditure

title: Continuous lunar night operations
description: Maintain power through prolonged darkness with beamed delivery from relay assets.
impact: Higher uptime for critical surface assets

title: Constellation power sharing
description: Sell surplus power between satellites and purchase additional power during high-demand windows.
impact: Less wasted energy, fewer curtailed operations

title: Covert satellites
description: Build satellites without large external solar panels by receiving power through compact beamed-energy receivers.
impact: Lower signature architectures with greater design flexibility

title: Reduced drag
description: Enable (V)LEO satellites with smaller cross-sectional area by reducing deployable panel footprint.
impact: Improved orbital lifetime and lower station-keeping demand

title: Reduced collision risk
description: Smaller satellites reduce collision cross-section and lower conjunction exposure in congested orbits.
impact: Safer constellation operations and reduced avoidance burden

title: Satellite lifetime extension
description: Supplement on-board power from external beamed sources to reduce battery cycling and support sustained operations.
impact: Longer service life and improved mission economics

title: Extend duty cycles during eclipse
description: Maintain higher operational duty cycles during eclipse windows by supplementing local power with beamed delivery.

title: Perpetual drone flight
description: Beam power to aerial platforms to sustain long-duration operations with reduced reliance on landing, refuel, or battery swap cycles.
impact: Persistent airborne coverage and higher operational availability
